sect1.para: The tutorial consists of a simple model, some test data for this model and a Java program to query the data. It includes the InterMine jar, its dependencies, the necessary configuration files and a build script.
Running the tutorial involves a few simple steps:

orderedlist.listitem: Download and unpack the latest InterMine tutorial (intermine-tutorial-xxxxxxxx), click here if you need an instruction.
Check prerequisites to see if you have environment setup.
Install the Ant build tool. Note that the ant executable must be on your PATH.
Ensure you have an running Tomcat installation, including the manager application.

Install the PostgreSQL database and create a database named "tutorial". Note that the postmaster must be set up to accept TCP/IP connections ("tcpip_socket=true" in postgresql.conf) from "localhost" (host 127.0.0.1 in pg_ident.conf). Consult the PostgreSQL documentation for more details on configuring access control and database creation.

Depending on your requirements there are a choice of targets that you can build. Issue the commands ant help to display user targets and ant -projecthelp for full target list. InterMine tutorial can demonstrate how to build a simple query according to an UML model, store some data corresponding to the model (accessing the database), and run some queries to retrieve the data.

Change to the tutorial root directory, modify the intermine.properties configuration file to reflect your database server name, database username, and password if necessary. Modify the build.properties configuration file ensuring the web application running properly.

Run the ant release-webapp command to release the tutorial web application to the server. The tutorial source (src/java/org/intermine/tutorial/SimpleQuery.java) demonstrates how to build a simple query for a model (model/tutorial/tutorial.zargo) and navigate the results, which can be compared to the test data (resources/tutorial_data.xml).
